intro: Cyperus baccha, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along the edges of ponds or in swampy areas. Its slender, grass-like leaves are usually arranged in a triangular cross-section, a characteristic feature of many Cyperaceae species. Cyperus baccha produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated.
